info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 10:13AM CDT until April 05 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Carlyle. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.2 feet, State Highway J just east of County Road 206 begins to flood near this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 20.7 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The river began a sharp rise Wednesday evening, first reaching flood stage at 1:30 AM on Thursday. The river crested at 26.2 feet Friday afternoon and has been falling since. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling below 15 feet by Tuesday. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri Kaskaskia River Vandalia 18.0 20.7 Sun 9 am 16.0 14.4 13.8 13.4 13.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
